qas.question: Where was pop star Frankie Vaughan from?
How many bands were active in the Liverpool area in the 1960s?
What was the first act to break through in the UK, not from Liverpool or managed by Brian Epstein?
Where were Freddie and the Dreamers based?
Where were Herman's Hermints and the Hollies from?
In what year did Freddie and the Dreamers get their first hit?
How many active bands did Manchester have in the 1960's?
How many local bands were still in Liverpool in the late 1960s?
What was the name of one of the band members in the Beatles?

context: <a0_0>Liverpool<a0_0/> produced a number of nationally and internationally successful popular singers in the 1950s, including traditional pop stars Frankie Vaughan and <b9_0>Lita Roza<b9_0/>, and one of the most successful British rock and roll stars in Billy Fury. Many Lancashire towns had vibrant skiffle scenes in the late 1950s, out of which by the early 1960s a flourishing culture of beat groups began to emerge, particularly around Liverpool and Manchester. It has been estimated that there were around <a1_0><b7_0><b8_0>350<b8_0/><b7_0/><a1_0/> bands active in and around Liverpool in this era, often playing ballrooms, concert halls and clubs, among them the Beatles. After their national success from <b5_0><b6_0>1962<b6_0/><b5_0/>, a number of Liverpool performers were able to follow them into the charts, including Gerry & the Pacemakers, the Searchers and Cilla Black. The first act to break through in the UK who were not from Liverpool, or managed by Brian Epstein, were <a2_0>Freddie and the Dreamers<a2_0/>, who were based in <a3_0><a4_0>Manchester<a4_0/><a3_0/>, as were Herman's Hermits and the Hollies. Led by the Beatles, beat groups from the region spearheaded the British Invasion of the US, which made a major contribution to the development of rock music. After the decline of beat groups in the late 1960s the centre of rock culture shifted to London and there were relatively few local bands who achieved national prominence until the growth of a disco funk scene and the punk rock revolution in the mid and late 1970s.
